com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support
Class MTTSupport

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support.MTTSupport
All Implemented Interfaces:
MTTLogic
Direct Known Subclasses:
MttSupportAdapter
public abstract class MTTSupport
extends Object
implements MTTLogic

MTT Support implements basic default behavior for MTTs.

Extending this class provides an easier entry for writing your own tournament logic.

Failed Seatings
Failed seatings are exceptions and are not considered part of normal execution. However, since the seating mechanism are controlled by third part we cannot guarantee that all seating requests are valid (e.g. someone can try to seat players on non-valid seats). Should this happen, the table will send a MttSeatingFailedAction to the tournament. If you are interested in handling this exception case then you need to override the visitor method for that action.

Author:
Fredrik

Method Detail

handle

public final void handle(MttAction action,
                         MttInstance mttInstance)

The action will be handled by a default visitor.

Any MTT Transport Action or actions not handled by the default visitor (TBD) will be sent back to the implementing MTT Support class for processing.

Specified by:
handle in interface MTTLogic

Returns:
the JmxHandler, never null

setTableCreator

@Deprecated
public final void setTableCreator(MttTableCreator creator)
Deprecated. This method should not be used, and will be removed in FB 1.7

The table creator was previously injected in the support for each event. From FB 1.6 the table creator should be accessed via the mtt instance object.

Handle a round report from a table within the given tournament

Parameters:

instance, - the tournament instance

process

public abstract void process(MttTablesCreatedAction action,
                             MttInstance instance)
Handle a tables created action. Currently this method will be called once for each batch of requested tables (and the action will contain a set of multiple table id). However, implementations of this method should not make assumptions that this is the case as the system reserves the right to split batches into sub-sets for performance reasons.

Parameters:
action - the action
instance - the tournament instance

process

public abstract void process(MttObjectAction action,
                             MttInstance instance)
Handle a scheduled tournament object action. This is a convenience method for the #process(ScheduledMttAction, MttInstance).

Parameters:
action - the action
instance - the tournament instance

process

public void process(MttSeatingFailedAction action,
                    MttInstance instance)

Override this to handle failed seating

A tournament seating at a table has failed. This most likely cause is that the seat was already taken. To handle this event in your implementation you should override this method. You do not need to invoke super.process(...) unless you want to keep the log entry.

Parameters:
action, - contains contextual information about the failed seating.
instance, - the tournament.

process

public void process(MttDataAction action,
                    MttInstance instance)
Handle a tournament data action. This default implementation doesn't do anything, override it if you wish to handle tournament data actions.

Parameters:
action - the data action
instance - the mtt instance

getPlayerInterceptor

public abstract PlayerInterceptor getPlayerInterceptor(MTTStateSupport state)
Return a player interceptor or null. If you override this and return null a the default behavior is to accept all registrations, including already registered players. See PlayerRegistry#register(MttInstance, MttPlayer) and PlayerRegistry.unregister(MttInstance, int).

createTables

public void createTables(MTTStateSupport state,
                         int numberOfTables,
                         String tableBaseName)
Creates tables for the given tournament. When the creation of the tables has finished, process(MttTablesCreatedAction, MttInstance) will be called asynchronously.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
numberOfTables - the number of tables, must be > 0
tableBaseName - the base name to prepend to the tables'

createTables

public void createTables(MTTStateSupport state,
                         int numberOfTables,
                         String tableBaseName,
                         Object attachment)
Creates tables for the given tournament. When the creation of the tables has finished, process(MttTablesCreatedAction, MttInstance) will be called asynchronously.

The attachment is optional, but if provided must be serializable.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
numberOfTables - the number of tables, must be > 0
tableBaseName - the base name to prepend to the tables'
attachment - Game/MTT specific serializable attachment that will be sent to MttAwareActivator.mttTableCreated(Table, int, Object, LobbyAttributeAccessor), may be null

closeTables

public void closeTables(MTTStateSupport state,
                        Collection<Integer> tables)
Closes the given tables. It is the responsibility of the caller of this method to check that the tables are empty before removing them.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
tables - a Collection of tableIds

closeTable

public void closeTable(MTTStateSupport state,
                       Integer tableId)
Closes a table. It is the responsibility of the caller of this method to check that the table is empty before removing it.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
tableId - the id of the table to close

seatPlayers

public void seatPlayers(MTTStateSupport state,
                        Collection<SeatingContainer> seating)
Seats a number of players at a number of tables. Calling this method will lead to a number of SeatPlayersMttActions being sent to a number of Tables. The seating will be done asynchronously, so the caller of this method cannot expect that the Tables have received the messages after returning from this call.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
seating - a Collection of SeatingContainers representing where each player should sit.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any player in the seating is not registered in this tournament

unseatPlayers

public void unseatPlayers(MTTStateSupport state,
                          int tableId,
                          Collection<Integer> players,
                          UnseatPlayersMttAction.Reason reason)
Unseats a number of players from a table. The UnseatPlayersMttAction.Reason provided will be used for all players. Calling this method will result in an UnseatPlayersMttAction being sent to the table, asynchronously. See seatPlayers(MTTStateSupport, Collection) for more information.

Parameters:
state - the state of the tournament, cannot be null
tableId -
players -
reason - The reason why these players are unseated. The same reason will be used for all players.

movePlayer

public void movePlayer(MTTStateSupport state,
                       int playerId,
                       int toTableId,
                       int toSeatId,
                       UnseatPlayersMttAction.Reason reason,
                       Serializable playerData)
Moves a player from one table to another. The move is performed by first unseating the player from the old table and then seating the player at the new table. See seatPlayers(MTTStateSupport, Collection) and #unseatPlayers(MTTStateSupport, int, Collection, Reason).

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
playerId -
toTableId -
toSeatId - the seatId where the player should sit at the new table, or -1 for first available seat
reason - the UnseatPlayersMttAction.Reason for this move
playerData - optional player data, can be null

sendRoundStartActionToTables

                                         Collection<Integer> tables)
Sends a StartMttRoundAction to the given tables.

Parameters:
state - the tournament state, cannot be null
tables - a Collection of tableIds of the tables to send the action to

                                        Integer tableId)
Sends a StartMttRoundAction to the given table.

Parameters:

tableId - the id of the table to send the start round action to

getTableIdByPlayerId

public int getTableIdByPlayerId(MTTStateSupport state,
                                int playerId)
Gets the tableId of the table where the given player is sitting.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
playerId - the id of the player to find the tableId for
Returns:
the tableId of the table where the given player is sitting, or -1 if the player is not found at any table

getRemainingPlayers

public Set<Integer> getRemainingPlayers(MTTStateSupport state)
Gets a Set of playerIds for all remaining players in the tournament. If no players have been seated, the returned Set will be empty. The Set is defensively created (by MTTStateSupport.getAllPlayers()) so modifying the Set has no effect on the seating.

Parameters:
state - the tournament's state, cannot be null
Returns:
a Set of playerIds for all remaining players in the tournament
